channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023100089
item.description:
Report E-2023100089

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN2810 Allyl Hexanoate release from a 30-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 2’ area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum, impacted absorbents, and PPE were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100088
item.description:
Report E-2023100088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 21, 2023, four (4) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (10W) to remediate the impacted site. The crew identified the impacted cargo and secured the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The crew utilized absorbents to collect the released material. All impacted solids were contained in a separate 55-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

item.description:

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT SMARTPOST PACKAGE CAME FROM THE OVERHEAD SORTER WET AND TORN OPEN. LQ MARKING OBSCURED BY SHIPPING LABEL. SMARTPOST TRACKING NUMBER IS OLD, TRK 9261290983497800001299 IS ALREADY DELIVERED BUT IS NOW LINKED ON SAME SHIPPING LABEL AS THIS PACKAGE. PACKAGE DAMAGED DURING OVERHEAD SORTATION, TOO MUCH RECIRCULATION. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE EMPTY WITH LOOSE SPRAYHEAD. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.description:

  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet from the top flaps. Absorbent was used to clean up the leakage. The package was then placed in a hazardous waste bag and then into a red hazardous bin. DescribePack: The top and side flaps were found wet from the outer and inner parts of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was picked up with double layered gloves. It was then but in a red hazardous bin that was layered with 2 sheets of absorbent, a clear hazardous waste bag, and then another 2 sheets of absorbent.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The Package was found to be wet/stain on the outer container when loaded to the van. Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote and taken for inspection. Upon inspection we found 1 of the 4 glass bottles had cracked/broken causing to leak out. all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: The body of one of the 4 glass bottles had crack/broken causing to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was place in a hazmat bag and tote.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was headed east bound on state route 12 in the community of Wallace located in Calavaras County. It appears the driver drifted off to the right shoulder of the highway hit loose gravel then over corrected ultimately losing controlled. Truck rolled on drivers side trapping the operator. Appox. 1500 gals of diesel fuel spilled out onto the hwy and surrounding vegetation. There was no water contamination.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on the dock ground of the spilling as it fell off the NC rollers. DescribePack: 1 of 2 bottles of Lancerclean was found with a crack on the it which caused it to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spill was contained using absorbent pads, and the package was placed in a hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2023090336
item.description:
Report X-2023090336

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to wet on the outer container while been loaded on to the van. Package was place in to a hazmat bag and tote and taken for inspection. Upon inspection we found 1 of the 4 bottles had cracked causing it to leak out. All clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: One of the four bottles cracked on the neck causing it to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in to a hazmat bag and tote.
